page.title: 04FARMING IN THE SANDY AREA
page.content: ALTHOUGH SOME OF THE LAND HAS BEEN DEVELOPED FOR LIGHT INDUSTRY, AGRICULTURE AND HORTICULTURE ARE STILL IMPORTANT IN THE SANDY AREA. THERE ARE A WIDE VARIETY OF CEREALS AND VEGETABLES GROWN. ALSO WELL CATERED FOR ARE THE AMATEUR GARDENERS AS THERE ARE SEVERAL NURSERIES AND GARDEN CENTRES IN THE AREA. ONE OF THE LARGEST IS BICKERDIKES SITUATED ALONGSIDE THE A1. THE NURSERY SIDE OF THE BUSINESS HAS BEEN GOING FOR OVER 100 YEARS, WITH THE GARDEN CENTRE OPENING ABOUT NINETEEN YEARS AGO. THE NURSERY COVERS APPROXIMATELY THREE AND A HALF ACRES. THE BUSIEST SEASON IS SPRING. THROUGHOUT THE YEAR APPROXIMATELY 75,000 PEOPLE VISIT THE GARDEN CENTRE, AND 200,000 PLANTS ARE SOLD. AS WELL AS PLANTS ALL TYPES OF GARDEN FURNITURE AND TOOLS ARE SOLD.
